zone.line: a delicacy & simplicity in his manners inexpressibly
attractive. By some strange fortune It has never been
my fortune to meet with him since our school boy days
but either I confound my present recollections with the
il delusions of past feelings, or he is now an honourab
a source of honour & utility to every one around him.
The tones of his voice were so soft & winning, that every
word peierced into my heart, & their pathos was so
deep that in listening to him the tears have often
in voluntarily gushed from my eyes. Such was the
being for whom I first experienced the sacred sentiment
of friendship. I remember in my simplicity writing
to my mother a long account of his admirable
qualities & my own devoted attachment. I suppose
she thought me out of my wits, for she returned no
answer to my letter. I remember we used to walk
by
the whole play hours up & down some moss covered
palings pouring out our hearts in youthful talk. We
used to speak of the ladies with whom we were
in love, & I remember that our usual practise was
to confirm each other in the everlasting fidelity
